protagonists.name: Celeste Hartwell

protagonists.name: Margot
protagonists.notes: French origin, working-class character, no surname yet assigned

supporting_characters.name: Augustus Hartwell
supporting_characters.notes: Roman emperor name (authority), matches Victorian upper-class

supporting_characters.notes: Common Victorian name, biblical origin, antagonist role

organizations.name: Van Helsing Society
organizations.notes: Reference to Dracula, vampire hunter organization

primary_setting.name: The Hartwell Mechanical Gardens
primary_setting.notes: Primary setting for entire series, locked location

primary_setting.name: 47 Cheyne Walk
primary_setting.notes: Real London address in wealthy Chelsea neighborhood

secondary_locations.name: Whitechapel
secondary_locations.significance: Location of Celeste's pre-vampire murders (1882), Jack the Ripper connection (1888)
secondary_locations.notes: Historical working-class area, infamous for Ripper murders

secondary_locations.name: Westminster
secondary_locations.notes: Seat of political power, symbolic for vampire hierarchy

secondary_locations.name: Chelsea
secondary_locations.significance: Wealthy Victorian neighborhood, 47 Cheyne Walk location
secondary_locations.notes: Upper-class area, contrasts with Margot's working-class origins

gardens_levels.name: Level 1 - Garden Levels
gardens_levels.notes: Margot's entry point, main living/working space

gardens_levels.name: Level 3 - Augustus's Secrets
gardens_levels.contents: Original workshop, victim records, Augustus's private lab

name_distribution.analysis: Good distribution, no initial duplication in main cast

phonetic_patterns.analysis: Mix of hard/soft sounds, good variety

celeste.notes: Appropriate for Victorian inventor, scientific connotation works

augustus.notes: Roman emperor name, Victorian upper-class appropriate

viktor.notes: Eastern European vampire association, but used for minor character

cliche_check.analysis: Overall low cliche usage, names fit period and characters

period_authenticity.analysis: All names period-authentic for 1885-1890 Victorian London
